questions.question_text: Which two are supported funding methods in Strategic Modeling? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I think C is correct because if you import essbase data in migration section, you will not lose data in the application which are not in Backup file. I think slices here means Cube. You can choose which cube so you want to import through migration.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true when executing a lifecycle management migration? Choose the best answer.

choices.A: Restoring Essbase data from a snapshot will remove any data that doesn't exist in the backup.
choices.D: All forms that do not exist in the snapshot will be deleted.
choices.C: Selected slices of data can be imported into Essbase.
choices.B: Importing Dimensions will remove members that do not exist in the snapshot.

questions.question_text: Which three are use cases for data maps? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: The answer should be BCD. Drill-back is not function of data maps.

Selected Answer: BCD
BCD is right

choices.A: To allow users to drill back to the data in a different cube.
choices.E: To create a replicated partition between cubes
choices.B: To integrate data between custom plan types and Planning modules
choices.D: To push data from a planning cube to a reporting cube
choices.C: To integrate data between Planning modules

choices.D: Dimensions in a row, column, or page that are flagged for the current point of view
choices.C: Dimensions not defined in a row, column, or page
choices.B: Dimensions that are tagged as type Account
choices.A: Dimensions that are tagged as type Time

questions.question_text: Which two are displayed on the user point of view bar within a financial report? Choose two.

choices.B: You want to report on Smart Lists in Planning, which you can't do in Planning
choices.C: You want to report on new Planning data originating from any source, such as a data warehouse
choices.A: You want to create and execute Calculation Manager business rules
choices.D: You want to create, maintain, and report on Attribute dimensions

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct
